item.title: Report X-2023051413
item.description:
Report X-2023051413

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-12T03:16:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-09
  • City: EASTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A SPILL IN TH SMALL SORT INDUCTS CHUTE. THE RESPONDER INSPECTED THE PACKAGING AND PRODUCT THAT WAS IN THE BOX. THE RESPONDER NOTICED THAT THE PRODUCT WAS DOT REGULATED UPON LOOKING UP THE SDS AND HAD NO HAZARD LABELS ON THE BOX. THE RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS TO CLEAN THE SPILL. THE RESPONDER THEN TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. THE RESPONDER CALLED THE UNDECLARED HOTLINE AND REPORTED THE PACKAGE AS A SUSPECTED UNDECLARED.

item.title: Report X-2023051358
item.description:
Report X-2023051358

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-12T03:16:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-23
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO DOOR WITH FULL PPE. DISCOVERED PACKAGE WITH CORROSIVE 8 LABEL WET ON CORNER OF BOX. RESPONDER READ DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET FOR A CORROSIVE LIQUID. ADDED SILVER SHIELD LINERS UNDER GLOVES AND TRANSPORTED PACKAGE TO DMP. RESPONDER PROCESSED TROUGH THE DMP AFTER ADDING SODIUM BICARBONATE TO NEUTRALIZE THE LIQUID. RESPONDER USED DISPOSAL CHART AND DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST AFTER THE DISPOSAL PROCESS.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet upon inspection of inner contents 2 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of surgipath acid alcohol 1% one 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release. no slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap leaking allowing .25 gallons to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-17

  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer a drum fell of the back of a pallet while the forklift operator was backing over the dockplate to exit the trailer. When the drum fell off the pallet it landed on its side and as a result it started to leak from the closure. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and the drum was uprighted and shipped to the ultimate consignee without further release or issue.

  • Description: When trailer was backed into unloading door it was observed that something was leaking from it. Apparently right before entering facility the driver had to slam on the brakes for deer crossing. As a result the freight loaded behind the IBC shifted and punctured the IBC contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was captured and absorbed with absorbents and balance of liquid left in the IBC was drained into recovery containers. All absorbents were placed into recovery containers.

item.title: Report X-2023050887
item.description:
Report X-2023050887

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-12T03:16:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-14
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A forklift operator was loading 2 pallets, of UN1133 into trailer 88996 at dock door 85. A forklift arm punctured one box, which contained 2 metal buckets that the OS on site advised were roughly 5 gallons each. The OS advised that at least one of the buckets was punctured and that the entire conten ts of the bucket leaked out. One of the yard workers noticed liquid leaking from screw holes in the side of the trailer. The workers on site put powder down to soak up what was leaking on the trailer and most of the spill was contained quickly once it was noticed. The liquid that dripped out of the side of the trailer dripped onto blacktop. The OS advised that they would place everything in a recovery drum after letting the powder do its job. The OS did not feel they needed a spill crew called out, I advised that if that changed to call me back.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-02
  • City: WEST MIDDLESEX
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft-by-4ft area of the trailer floor and a 2ft-by-2ft area of the concrete dock floor and estimated that two (2) gallons of material was released due to load shift during transit. Hepaco personnel removed all the cargo from the trailer and confirmed that only two (2) 1-gallon plastic jugs were crushed and approximately twelve (12) boxes were impacted by the released material. Hepaco personnel neutralized the impacted areas and deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and collected the spent absorbents and placed them into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and placed an impacted pallet, cardboard, and debris into an additional 55-gallon poly drum and both drums were staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilizing. The nondamaged cargo was shipped on to the consignee. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XPH experienced an over the road release of UN1866 GTP AB-Dispersant from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. The damaged drum and cleanup debris were containerized into a 95-gallon metal drum. The waste was transported to the XPO terminal located in King of Prussia, PA for terminal personnel to manage

item.title: Report X-2023040780
item.description:
Report X-2023040780

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-12T03:16:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-14
  • City: LANCASTER
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Courier from our station in Lancaster, PA was beginning their delivery route when it came to his attention that a package out for delivery was warm to the touch and was beginning to smoke and have thermal runaway. Package was packed in a FedEx pak and originated in Hong Kong. It was reported the package was damaged when it arrived to the station location. Cause of damage is unknown The courier took the package back to the station and it was placed in a steel salvage drum. Inspection of the package found that it contained an Infrared Thermal Camera used for inspections. This camera was placed in a soft pouch and was not packed in a sturdy outer box. This camera contained a 3.7V lithium battery which would have fallen under a UN 3481 Section II and markings were not required. Incident was called in into the NRC under report number 1364813. Package being held pending FAA disposition.

There was Styrofoam for packing but no slotted partitions or absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed. Contents contained and awaiting disposition. The 1 -one gallon plastic bottle was punctured on the side at bottom of bottle allowing .20 gallons to release. No packing or absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials, followed contents contained and waiting disposition. DescribePack: The 1- one gallon plastic bottle of Sunnyside Muriatic Acid was punctured on the side of bottle releasing .20 gallons. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a red lined tote to contain the leaking package and then taken to the hazmat cage.

Each jug was taken out of the box using gloves and were checked for any additional leakage. One other jug was noted to have a loose cap as well as the initial one that was discovered. Upon looking up the SDS for this product, it was noted that it was registered as a Hazardous Material according to the DOT although it was not declared as one. DescribePack: Two out of the six jugs of Bleach had loose caps causing it to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The lids on all bottles of bleach were tightened to ensure no additional leakage while investigating the incident.

Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately all 5-gallons of product released to a 1' x 8' area of the trailer floor due to a puncture caused by an unknown source. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged pail and cleanup debris were placed into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: Norfolk Southern personnel found tank car PROX42108 leaking from the manway under movement. Upon inspection by a contractor, the leak was the result of a defective spring assist on the manway hinge preventing the manway from sealing properly. The spring assist was removed. The manway was sealed and the car was held pending an approved OTMA being obtained by the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2023030784
item.description:
Report E-2023030784

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-18
  • City: WEST MIDDLESEX
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Environmental Remediation & Recovery was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft-by-12ft area of the concrete terminal floor and estimated that fifteen (15) gallon of material was released. Environmental Remediation & Recovery personnel stated that the material was released from a 275-gallon poly tote due to a forklift accident. Environmental Remediation & Recovery personnel transferred the remaining material from the damaged tote to a new tote to be shipped on to the consignee. The contractor deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and collected the spent material and containerized it in two (2) 55-gallon poly drums along with the cut-up damaged poly tote. The generated waste staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilizing. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer material handler discovered two pails that were leaking from the lid closure. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the two crushed pails.

item.title: Report E-2023030704
item.description:
Report E-2023030704

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-06
  • City: KLINGERSTOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At the end of the unload the driver noticed his hose jump which is indicative of the fact that the compartment is empty. he shut all the valves down. he then cracked open the external valve open as well as the internal and walked the line to the customer tank and then shut down again. He then opened the bleeder valve all the way which relieves the pressure trapped in the lines. Air and a little bit of product came out in his bucket. He then went to disconnect and the 3-4 ounces sprayed out on the wall, the fill line, and on his PPE. He first ran to the shower and rinsed off his PPE. Nothing got on his skin. Then he rinsed his out his hoses and rinsed down the wall in the containment area. This means either the main valves on our trailer weren't holding which allowed air pressure to seep past and recharge the discharge hoses with air pressure or that the customer tank backflowed air pressure.

  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XMI experienced a release from three 50-pound poly bags. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4-pounds of product released to 3’ x 3’ & 6’ x 1’ areas of the trailer floor due to improper blocking & bracing. A hepa-vac was utilized to collect all released product. The damaged bags and cleanup debris were then placed into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: BENSALEM

  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: EnviroServe was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted two 10ft-by-28ft area of the trailer floors and a 10ft-by-30ft area of concrete terminal floor. EnviroServe personnel estimated that twenty-five (25) gallons of material was released. EnviroServe personnel stated that the asphalt parking lot under the trailers were also impacted in an area of 20ft-by53ft. EnviroServe personnel neutralized the impacted areas and used granular absorbents to collect the material. The 225 gallons remaining in the damaged poly tote was transferred into a new tote to forwarded on to the consignee. The spent absorbents and debris were placed into six (6) 55-gallon poly drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilizing.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XPB experienced a UN1760 "Bulk Kleen 842" release from a 275-gallon poly tote due to a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 90-gallons of product released to a 20' x 20' area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all spent absorbents into (12) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report X-2023021029

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-10
  • City: EASTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE OUTBOUND AREA. THE RESPONDER OPENED THE BOX TO INVESTIGATE THE CAUSE OF THE LEAK. THE RESPONDER FOUND THAT THERE WAS AN UNDECLARED SPILLABLE LEAD-ACID CAR BATTERY IN THE BOX CAUSING THE LEAK. THE RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DECSION TREE AND PROPER RESPONSE SHEET TO CONTAIN AND CLEANUP THE SPILL. THE RESPONDER CAREFULLY CHECKED THE PH OF THE LIQUID AND APPLIED SODIUM BICARBONATE ON THE SPILL TO NEUTRALIZE THE BATTERY ACID, THE BATTERY ACID WAS THEN ABSORBED WITH ZEP AND TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESING / NOTIFYING THE HAZMAT HOTLINE.

item.title: Report X-2023020913
item.description:
Report X-2023020913

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-15
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment was taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. The package was in the unload on trailer #54684 wet damaged and leaking. Upon inspecting the inner contents, the 1x1 gallon metal paint can of primer coating had a lid open causing .60 gallons to release. No paint clips. Paper and a corrugated liner were used for packing. Not enough packing for the box and product. Could have used a smaller box. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed, contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The 1 x 1 gallon metal paint can of primer coating had a loose lid no paint clips causing the paint to spill out. Smaller box would have worked better for the product. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote to contain the leaking package and then was taken to the hazmat cage.

  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XHG experienced a NA1993 "Nalco EC 5020A" release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released to the tote body due to a crack on the tote top. The material was transferred into a new tote and shipped on. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO PURGE AREA WITH FULL PPE AND FOUND CORROSIVE 8 PACKAGE LEAKING FROM CORNER OF BOX. READ DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET FOR A CORROSIVE 8 LIQUID. ADDED SILVER SHIELD LINERS UNDER MY GLOVES. CONTINUED READING RESPONSE SHEET AND ADDED SODIUM BICARBONATE TO THE SMALL SPILL, NEUTRALIZING THE PH LEVEL TO WITHIN 6-9. RESPONDER ADDED ZEP ZORBENT TO MIXTURE, AND TRANSPORTED SPILL RESIDUE TO THE DMP AREA AND PROCESSED DAMAGE THROUGH THE DMP AFTER READING THE WASTE DISPOSAL CHART. RESPONDER REFERRED TO THE DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST AFTER THE DISPOSAL PROCESS WAS COMPLETE.

item.title: Report E-2023020403
item.description:
Report E-2023020403

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-16
  • City: Wampum
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HITTMAN TRANSPORT SERVICES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: An exclusive use shipment [manifest number DM-23-020, proper shipping names Radioactive material, low specific activity (LSA-II)] of two metal boxes of equipment from Dresden Nuclear Power Station in Morris, IL arrived at Alaron Nuclear Services' Wampum, PA facility mid-afternoon on February 16, 2023. The carrier was Hittman Transport. After offloading the two packages from the trailer during receipt of the shipment, a direct radiological survey was performed on the trailer that identified an approximately two inch by two inch area that was 10,000 counts per minute (100,000 disintegrations per minute with instrument efficiency or 0.045 microcurie) per probe area. The instrument used for the radiological survey was a Ludlum Instruments Model 3 with a 16cm^2 geiger-mueller probe at ten percent efficiency. The trailer was isolated and the elevated area of activity was removed by spraying the area with degreaser and wiping the area with a rag. Gamma spectroscopy analysis indicated the activity captured on the rag to be Cobalt 60. The rag was contained and will be disposed with other routine facility radiological waste. The trailer was then resurveyed, found to be free of radioactive contamination, and was released back to the carrier. There was no evidence of damage to, or leakage from, the packages in the shipment and the area of contamination was outside of the footprint of the packages' placement on the trailer, thus the origin of the radioactive material is unknown.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was already in a salvage drum on the hazmat pallet on the QA floor. I grabbed my PPE, so I inspected it after another administrator informed me of what happened with the hazmat. That a manager opened up the trailer door in the unload and found the hazmat leaking inside the trailer with some type of weight that fell on the hazmat. It got damaged during transit. DescribePack: There is a medium size dent on the upper side of the bottle and the cap was loose and not completely screwed on. The bottle was soaked when I pulled it out the plastic bag. DurationRel: 10 and MitigateEffect: Kept the box and the bottles upright to ensure there's no more leakage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: I found the damaged hazmat in a bin on the hazmat pallet in QA. I went and grabbed my PPE, because there is a Corrosive dot on the hazmat. There is a big wet spot on the bottom of the box, completely soaked. There were a few wet spots at the top of the box as well. As I began to open the box, I noticed there were four 1 gallon bottles, also there were two bags that contain 2 bottles each and a sheet of bubble wrap. Both of the inside of the bag are wet. As I pulled them out of the bags, that is when I noticed the cracks. DescribePack: There is one small crack at the seam at near the top of the bottle by the caps on two of the bottles. DurationRel: 10 and MitigateEffect: Quickly put them in a bin and kept it upright to avoid more leakage.

ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to the trailer floor in a 20' x 30' area as well as to the concrete lot below the trailer due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 65-gallon metal overpack. Oil Dri was deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On January 25,2023, Sun Country Flight 8200 GPT to ABE had an incident in which a passenger's personal battery charger became warm and steps were taken by the flight attendants to ensure the situation did not escalate. The flight attendants had just began service and smelled something unusual like plastic burning. The passenger(7B) handed the battery charger to another employee and he passed it along to the flight attendant. There was no smoke or fire. One flight attendants took the device to the aft galley and placed it in water and stored it in PSK(galley carrier) per the standard procedure. No further issues inflight. The cooled device was returned to the passenger upon landing. Passenger information per the manifest: Tara Mertens 4156 Nicholas St Easton, PA 18045 Phone: 610-554-2003 taramertens4880@gmail.com

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The metal pail of sealer was in hazardous bin on the hazmat pallet in QA. I grabbed all of my PPE, which was the gloves, goggles & apron to inspect the pail. As I began to open the bin to inspect, I noticed a very strong odor. So I moved everything to the HWSA where the hooded vent was to help reduce the odor coming from the pail. DescribePack: There is a dent on the side at the top of the pail where the lid covers the top opening of the pail. It was pushed in and moved up a bit to where it created an opening and leaked out the sealer. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: As I brought the pail to the HWSA to inspect it further to see if its still leaking, but it wasn't. It was set upright before I inspected it. I went ahead and put it in the plastic lined salvage drum

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: January 05, 2023, DHL Supply Chain called in to request assistance with a 55-gallon spill of UN3082 "LESCO Three-Way Selective Herbicide" from a 55-gallon plastic drum caused by a forklift puncture. Miller arrived onsite and confirmed 100ft by 12ft stretch of the parking lot was impacted, a small puddle in front of the truck and a 12ft by 8ft area inside of the trailer floor was impacted by the release. DHL personnel used boom and protected the onsite drain from being impacted prior to the contractor arriving. Miller used granular absorbents to collect the released material. All onsite work was completed on January 06, 2023, 1–55-gallon DM containing liquid, and 3–55-gallon DMs containing impacted absorbents were generated from this incident. Waste still pending disposal.

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A DECLARED DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE WITH SHIPPING PAPERS CONTAINING ETHANOL SOLUTION WAS FOUND LEAKING. DESIGNATED RESPONDER SEGREGATED THE PACKAGE AND INSPECTED THE CONTENTS. THERE WERE TWO INNER BOTTLES LABELED AS LDS CONCENTRATE UNFRAGRANCED. BOTH CONTAINERS WERE LEAKING FROM THEIR LIDS. APPROXIMATELY HALF LEAKED FROM THE CONTAINERS. THE SHIPPER HAD TAPE AROUNDS THE CAPS, BUT THE TAPE WAS NOT SUFFICIENT TO CONTAIN THE LIQUID. THE PACKAGE HAD PASSED A DANGEROUS GOODS ACCEPTANCE AUDIT PRIOR TO THE PACKAGE LEAKING. THE PACKAGE AND CONTENTS HAVE BEEN DISPOSED OF.

  • Description: At 1155 ET, XPO logistics terminal XYH called to report a 1-quart release of Outright spray tank cleaner from a 1 gallon poly jug due to an unknown cause. ERTS dispatched contractors to complete cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-quart of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the metal drum lid the box was placed on due to the box being crushed as a result of improper loading. The damaged product was collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. A box of "Venerate" was compromised due to impact and was placed into a separate 55-gallon poly drum. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were containerized into another 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: NEW COLUMBIA

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal XMI called in to report an 8-ounce spill of UN2920 "MAQUAT 2420-80" from a 250-gallon poly tote due to a pinhole puncture at the bottom of an unknown origin and impacting their dock floor. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-pint of product released to the trailer and dock floor in a 1' x 2' area due to a pinhole puncture. The material was transferred into a new tote. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted area. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized with all cleanup debris into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-12
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I found the package in a hazardous material red tote with a bag and SpillTech pad under the package in QA. I put on proper PPE to inspect the package and check if there's any visible damage to the box. The box was already opened, and I can see one bottle has less amount of Isopropyl Alcohol than the other three bottles. I moved the tote to the HWSA to the vent to check the container for damage since there was a wet spot inside the box next to the container. DescribePack: There is no package material to protect the bottles from impact. Bottom box corner of where the bottle was is pushed in. The bottle itself has a bit loose cap due to the cracks on the seam right under the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was placed in a tote upright then moved into a drum.

  • City: NORTHAMPTON

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was improperly put on the belt to go upstairs, and then improperly sent down a chute where it collided with other packages and broke. The package was placed into a lined bin and the area was covered in Amphomag to neutralize the acid. Wearing personal protective equipment, the spill was cleaned up using absorbent pads and paper towel. DescribePack: The package was crushed by other packages coming down the chute and broke. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Area was cleared out, and Amphomag was spread over the entire spill.

  • Description: Additional shipments were shipped with similar commodities: 606417188517,606417188491, 606417188561, 606417188540On 12-01-2022 at approximately 1645, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 291188 at the station location in Middletown, reporting a undeclared flammable solid spill. The shipment 4 plastic bottles, each individually bagged in plastic and separated by dividers. The shipment emitted an odor. Further research revealed that one of the bottles leaked inside of the box. An online sds classified this shipment as a flammable solid. The package did not have to markings. labeling, packaging and paperwork that was required by IATA. 4 more shipments have shipped and all 5 are being held for an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2023010453
item.description:
Report E-2023010453

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-29
  • City: WARMINSTER
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LOGIFLEX
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 29, 2022, Logiflex notified ERTS of a 50-plus gallon release of UN 2735 Corrgaurd from a 330-gallon tote inside a trailer and in the yard of a Castrol facility. Enviroserve arrived on site and entered the trailer but could not confirm why totes were leaking. The tops were sunken in, but no product was visible. The crew used a forklift to unload the trailer and stated that the tote suspect to leaking was at the front of the trailer. Enviroserve was on the last tote and stated the tote was leaking due to a nail puncture on the bottom of the tote. It was estimated 30 gallons impacted a 47ft by 8 ft area of the trailer and approximately one gallon spilled outside of the trailer and impacted a 5ft by 2ft area of the ashpalt of the parking lot. Enviroserve shredded the damaged tote and placed it into a 55-gallon poly waste drum. The trailer floor was worked in and applying absorbents and sweeping them into poly drums. All undamaged totes were then loaded onto the trailer and would be returned to the shipper. (5) poly drums were generated and staged at the terminal until profiled then disposed of properly.

item.description:

  • City: MORRISVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHERN IONICS INCORPORATED
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Facility was receiving a load of sodium bisulfite 40% into its SBS tank (Tank 19).  During the receipt, the tank ruptured releasing the entire contents into our tank farm containment dike and splashing over to the covered truck loading bays. A vent trap exterior to the storage tank that scrubs the tank's head space as it is filled was frozen due to the extreme low temperatures in the days before the release. The vent trap is a small storage tank containing water where the working losses of the storage tank are sparged through the water before being released to atmosphere. Two emergency response contractors were called but facility employees pumped the containment before the emergency response contractors could arrive. No injuries. Release was not reportable to government agencies as the chemical did not release “into the environment”.

item.title: Report X-2022120972
item.description:
Report X-2022120972

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-18
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I was informed by a tugger that a package on the unload j-loop, just off of the conveyor belt was dripping something. The box was immediately placed in a hazmat lined bin and taken to the hazmat cage hood fan/vent. A very small amount was on the floor, and was cleaned up with absorbent pads, which were placed in the bin as well. Once in the hood vent the package began emitting smoke. The cage was isolated and I called the FedEx spill response service, who came in approximately four hours later and completely cleaned the hazmat cage area and placed the broken product and box, bag and pads in a 55 gallon hazmat bin. Their protective equipment was all placed in a separate 55 gallon hazmat bin and they were sealed. I believe the company was EnviroCare. DescribePack: The bottle was broken, but other than that I do not know how. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The small amount which spilled was immediately absorbed with pads and placed in bin. The FedEx spill response service performed the cleaning of the hazmat cage area and sealed the product and all related items in drums.

item.title: Report X-2022120904
item.description:
Report X-2022120904

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-14
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I see a drum with a RTS label with the reason being damaged in front of QA and I pull the drum back into QA to inspect. The reason why I am inspecting is because we do not use drum to return damaged item back to the shipper. Before opening the drum, I went ahead to search for the damage package report on OP2 to see what the items in the drum are. When I found the item name in the description and see there is only one damaged item out of four. I went ahead and put on proper PPE to inspect the damaged item. There were four items in a bag with an invoice and SDS. There is no packing material to keep the items in place. Since there was a SDS in the drum, I went to section 14 to confirm this is a nonhazardous item, but it is regulated by the DOT. I did my own DPR using the drum as a packaging to avoid assumptions on the original box and process an ISF. DescribePack: There is a crack by the handle on the container. The crack was a big as a quarter. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Bottle is kept upright and in a bag lined drum.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came to QA in a black tote. When I first saw the box, I can see there was corrosion all over the box along with wet spot. I put on the proper PPE to be on the safe side. Once opening the box, I can smell the sodium hypochlorite and noticed there was liquid pooling under the box in the bag. The four bottles were in a bag tied in a regular cardboard box. I looked up the SDS first before processing the damage report to ensure this is a hazardous material and need proper paperworks. DescribePack: It was not shipped in a proper fiberboard box or a box that can withstand the pressure for a LQ items. The box looked crushed and wet. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed in a tote to prevent any spillage onto other packages or on the pallet. I moved the package into salvage drum to contain all the liquid leaking.

  • Description: At 0620 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (XMI) about a cargo release. It was reported that due improper loading (arrived leaking) an unknown amount of Swell Grill and Oven Cleaner (Hazardous - UN1760) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3-gallons of product released to the trailer floor in a 3' x 3' area due to a puncture. The area was cleaned with Spill Tackle and neutralized. Three damaged jugs and all cleanup debris were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

  • Description: At 1442 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (XPH) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to a forklift puncture approximately 20-gallons of Potassium Hydroxide Solution(Hazardous - UN1814) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer and dock floor. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3-gallons of product released to the dock floor in a 30' x 15' area, the yard in a 20' x 12' area, and the trailer in a 30' x 8' area due to a puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 65-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted area and collected into three 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: NORTH HUNTINGDON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1.E-2022120305 XPB reported a release of 1-2 gallons of "Nex-Brite" (UN3264) from a 55-gallon poly drum due to a forklift puncture inside of the trailer. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to the trailer floor in a 1' x 28' area and the asphalt lot below in a 10' x 175' area due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly drum. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were then collected into four 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage. 2.E-2022120538 During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the poly 55 gallon drum of nex-brite (un3265) releasing 2 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2022120402
item.description:
Report E-2022120402

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-10
  • City: ATGLEN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AIR PRODUCTS AND CHEMICALS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 11/10/22 at approximately 8:42 pm, a fully loaded LIN tanker was involved in a non-preventable vehicle accident which resulted in a rollover. While approaching an intersection on a 2-lane road, the Air Products driver remained in the right lane, with the intention of proceeding straight through the intersection. As the Air Products driver entered the intersection, a passenger sedan from the opposite lane of travel turned in front of the Air Products tractor, resulting in a collision. The force of the collision resulted in loss of control and a rollover. The trailer vessel cracked causing full release of product onto the roadway. Upon investigation the inner-outer vessel cracked at the front of the trailer from impact with roadway. Trailer lost vacuum and emptied 5673 liquid gallons of LIN within 2 hours. Photos of accident scene attached. The NRC initial report did state that at least one person was taken to hospital for treatment, however this was a result of the accident and not the hazmat release.

item.title: Report E-2022120357
item.description:
Report E-2022120357

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-16
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0939 ET, XPO Logistics terminal XHG called ERTS to request assistance. The terminal had trailer 3111362 arrive at dock door 53 at 0930 ET with an overwhelming odor coming from it. The terminal did not feel comfortable opening the trailer and investigating to figure out what the release was and requested contractor assistance. ERTS dispatched contractors to assess and conduct site cleanup and containment as necessary. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed Isopropenylbenzene released from a 55-gallon metal drum due to a loose bung cap. The drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. Crew advised after further assessment, a second drum of the same material released due to a pinhole puncture. This drum was also overpacked into an 85-gallon metal drum. Absorbents were worked into the impacted trailer floor and collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022120151
item.description:
Report E-2022120151

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-04
  • City: SMITHTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 04, 2022, Landstar Ranger contacted ERTS to report a spill that occurred inside a trailer located at 122 Fitz Henry Rd in Smithton, PA. The spill consisted of a UN1866 resin solution, likely damaged due to improper loading as the contents were found along the walls of the trailer and the drum was dented along the side, resulting in approximately 0.5 gallons released. Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed a 1 ft-by 2ft area of wood trailer floor that was impacted by the released material. Hepaco personnel stated that the damaged container was not present. Hepaco personnel applied a degreaser to the impacted area and used absorbent pads to wipe down the residue. The spent absorbent pads were placed into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste containers were transported offsite by Hepaco personnel to process for disposal.

  • Description: At 1654 EST, XPO Terminal XLF notified ERTS of a spill that occurred on the dock in Woodland, PA. The spill consisted of a poly pails of UN2796 Securiganth Acid Conditioner, which arrived at the terminal in a damaged condition. The can was found leaking on a pallet likely due to improper loading. ERTS dispatched EnviroServe to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to the dock floor in a 5' x 10' area due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were worked into the impacted areas and collected. The damaged pail and all impacted absorbents were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum which was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022110106
item.description:
Report E-2022110106

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-03
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal XHG reported a spill of an unknown amount an unidentified product coming off of a trailer that pulled into their yard that had impacted the trailer itself as well as the asphalt beneath it. ERTS dispatched First Call Environmental to conduct cleanup. At 0330 ET, FCE personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 40-gallons of UN170 "Descaler" released from a 55 gallon poly drum. The drum was crushed resulting in a release to a 4' x 4' area of the trailer floor and an 8' x 10' area of asphalt lot below the trailer. The damaged drum was containerized into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were worked into the impacted areas. Sodium bicarb was then used to neutralize the impacted areas. All waste was placed into two 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022110642
item.description:
Report E-2022110642

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-26
  • City: DUNBAR
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/26/2022, at 1436 hours, personnel in the CSXT Connellsville Yard discovered UTLX 647538, a loaded tank car of Acrylic Acid, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, National Response Center, and Pennsylvania Department of Environmental Protection were notified. (CHEMTREC Report #2022-1026-00230). Specialized Professional Services, Inc, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found an active leak from the liquid valve packing gland nut. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper, Mr. Wayne Meadows, phone 832-205-6586. Contractor personnel tightened the packing gland nut and secured the observed release. Due to weather conditions personnel were unable to confirm if the liquid valve packing gland was the only point of release, and contractor personnel returned the next day, applied 4-5 psi of air to the service equipment and observed a defective liquid valve leaking in the closed position. As of this 5800.1 report, the car remains on hold pending replacement of the defective component. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 is required. Cause Code: 296 NARRI:40

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO called in to report that when his driver went to pickup a trailer at terminal XAQ he noticed a minimum of 4-gallon of product spilling out of the sealed trailer and onto the asphalt below. ERTS dispatched First Call Environmental to assess and complete cleanup. At 0240 ET, FCE personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5 gallons of UN1866 "Derakane Signia 411 Epoxy" released from a 55 gallon metal drum due to a puncture. The product impacted a 2' x 8' area of asphalt under the trailer and a 1' x 1' area of the trailer floor. The damaged drum was placed into an 85 gallon metal overpack. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted area and collected into a 55 gallon metal drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: KING OF PRUSSIA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 28, 2022, at 1548 ET, XPO terminal XPH reported a spill that occurred on 10/26/22 on the dock in King Of Prussia, PA. The spill consisted of a 55-gallon metal drum containing UN2735 Jeffamine D-230, which suffered damage to the bottom of the drum. ERTS dispatched EnviroServe to conduct cleanup. At 1851 ET, EnviroServe personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5 cups of product released to a 1’ x 1' area of the concrete dock floor. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area and then collected and containerized along with the damaged drum into an 85-gallon metal overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022100807
item.description:
Report E-2022100807

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-22
  • City: PITT
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Wheeling and Lake Erie Railway
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When a WLE train crew at the WLE Rook Yard was passing through the yard, they noticed an odor coming from Tank Car PROX 45361. When they investigated, they could hear a hissing coming from the top of the car. They notified the WLE Yardmaster who then called myself, John Vergis, Hazardous Materials Officer for the WLE. I called Specialized Professional Services out of Washington, PA to go out and investigate. When they arrived, they found that the Vacuum Relief Device was failed and allowing the car to exhaust fumes. They wrapped a rubber glove around the device and taped the glove at the base of the valve. I then contacted Chemtrec who put me in contact with Tyler Trafford from the shipper who was Gunvor. They had UTLX come out on 11-3-2022 and replace the faulty valve. The car was then released for transportation.

item.title: Report E-2022100804
item.description:
Report E-2022100804

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-08
  • City: CARNEGIE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Wheeling and Lake Erie Railway
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When the Rook Yard Conductor was walking his train, he noticed tank car PROX 43540 leaking from the manway lid. They contacted the WLE Rook yard Yardmaster who then contacted myself, John Vergis Hazardous Materials Officer for WLE. I then called Specialized Professional Services our of Washington, PA to go to the yard and look at the car. When they investigated, they found that the manway bolts were not tightened properly which allowed for the leak. They opened the manway and inspected the gasket which appeared to be in good shape. They then closed the lid and properly tightened and installed new seal and wiped down the side of the car. The car was then released for transportation.

item.title: Report E-2022100792
item.description:
Report E-2022100792

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-26
  • City: HOOKSTOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HIGHWAY TRANSPORT CHEMICAL, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Highway Transport (HT) driver loaded at the shipper and was released once the trailer was loaded. This was a Shipper load, no assistance from the driver. HT driver signed for paperwork, weighed out and left the shipper. Approximately two miles down the road a motorist informed HT driver that the trailer was leaking. HT driver drove approximately one to two miles further before looking for a safe place to pull over and check the trailer. Once stopped, HT driver confirmed that the trailer was leaking and contacted the Service Center Manager in Pittsburg, PA. Emergency crews were called out and the area surrounding the tractor and trailer were secured. HT dispatched Hill International to come out and repair the trailer. This is when it was determined that the dome lid was leaking on the trailer. Mechanic reported to HT that the dome lid was not secured (wing nuts loose) and that he was going to secure the dome lid. After doing so, the driver was released to continue to our Pittsburg, PA Service Center. After arriving to our Service Center, it was discovered that the trailer continued to leak. The mechanic from the same the company was dispatched to our Service Center for a more detailed inspection of the trailer. This is when it was discovered that the dome lid was missing the gasket and that is what contributed to the spill. Once the dome lid gasket was installed, then we tested the trailer by performing numerous bump test, and no more leaks was discovered. Trailer was released and driver made delivery without any more problems.

  • Description: On October 19, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint (UN1263) was damaged by a floor operator and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior and asphalt underneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Lewis Environmental Group (LEG) to perform the necessary corrective actions. LEG personnel utilized absorbents, degreaser, and hand tools to remediate the impacted surfaces, then containerized all paint-impacted material into two (2) 55-gallon drums. The damaged 55-gallon drum was placed into one (1) 95-gallon overpack.

At 1240 ET, Miller personnel arrived onsite but the tote was no longer onsite to be inspected. XPO confirmed a minimal amount of product released out of the cap and XPO terminal personnel tightened the lid & shipped it off. No waste was generated.

Report X-2022101094

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-12
  • City: EASTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A SPILL IN THE LOADING AREA. THE RESPONDER LOOK AT THE DISCISION TREE REFRENCE GUIDE, ALONG WITH WASTE DISPOSAL CHART TO RESPOND APPROPRIATELY TO THE SPILL. THE RESPONDER ABSORBED THE PUDDLE ON THE FLOOR FROM THE LEAKING HAZMAT BOX WITH ABSORBENT TO CONTAIN THE SPILL AND THEN STARTED TO CLEANUP THE SPILL USING PROPER PPE. THE RESPONDER THEN TRANSPORTED THE LEAKING PACKAGE TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON INSPECTION OF THE PACKAGE THE RESPONDER NOTICED THAT THE METAL LID ON THE CONTAINER WAS NOT PROPERLY SEALED AND WAS THE MAIN SOURCE THE LEAK. THE RESPONDER THEN STARTED THE PROCESS THROUGHT THE DMP.

  • City: CLINTON

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was unloaded from a trailer and was being moved to our Tugger carts for transport to the QA cage, but when it was being handled, and moved to the tugger the package handler realized that it was wet. The package handler had some irritation in his hands, and went to wash them. The Unload then contacted QA to come and respond to the leaking hazmat. The QA team retrieved the package with proper PPE, and placed it into a drum to process. DescribePack: One of the caps on top of the 1 gallon bottles was loose. The contents, reagent alcohol (UN1987), leaked out around the cap and soaked into the packaging as well as through it. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Timely response to the spill, and placing it in a drum to control the spill.

item.description:
Report X-2022100977

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-07
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I noticed a bunch of Hazmat packages in a cart, which was dropped off in QA. I see this hazmat package was placed upside-down on another hazmat package (Trk #278696961480) and noticed the box itself and the surrounding packages was wet. I put on proper PPE to turn the box upright and placed it in bag lined red tote. I brought the affected packages to the hazmat cage to inspect further. DescribePack: Bottom of the box broke open and was placed upside-down on the cart. This caused the bottles to start leaking onto two other packages. Two bottles have leaked. One bottle's cap was loose while the other bottle's cap wasn't too loose, but it was a bit loose enough to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I turn the package in its upright position and placed in a tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Upon inspection of inner contents 4 X 1 Gallon plastic bottles 70% isopropyl alcohol. Package came off of trailer #558991 already damaged/leaking. One out of four 1 Gallon plastic bottles of isopropyl alcohol had a loose cap allowing 0.75 gallons to release. The other three 1 Gallon plastic bottles of isopropyl alcohol were not damaged. There were no slotted partitions or absorbent pad found. Facility for damaged hazardous materials followed. Contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: Package came to QA wet. 1 out of 4 Gallon bottles had a loose cap leaking out contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a hazmat bag lined red tote.

item.description:
Report X-2022100850

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-02
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package had molded cardboard underneath all four bottles, but the top piece of molded cardboard was not in the package, nor were there partitions between the bottles, allowing the bottles to move around inside the box. When the package was discovered during unload, the event had already occurred and the box was dry. The sound of broken glass was detected. The package was placed in a lined bin and brought to QA where it was processed as damaged. DescribePack: The upper piece of molded cardboard, which was present in several of the other boxes also containing methanol, was not inside the box when it was opened. Nor were there partitions of any kind between the bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Since the event occurred during transit, and by the time it was discovered, the box was dry, there were no actions taken that i know of, other than collecting all the broken bottle pieces and including them in the damage bin.

  • Description: 10-15-22/0409: An 042 forklift blade punctured the bottom of a 55 gallon drum. The drum was on a pallet that had failed and the drum was resting below the surface of the pallet and into the blade chase on the broken pallet. The spill was inside the trailer and partially on the dock approach under the rear of the trailer. Staydry and kitty litter were used to absorb the spill. No run off from the spill under the trlr. The damaged drum was placed up-side down inside a recovery drum and will be held for OSandD.

  • Description: On October 11, 2022, at 1527 ET, XPO reported a spill in Greencastle PA. XPO advised that (4) 55 gallon metal drums that were inside a trailer appeared to have loose caps and leaked product on the lids. ERTS dispatched Hepaco to assess the drums and conduct cleanup. At 1650 ET, Hepaco personnel arrived onsite. All caps were secured and all product that released was evaporated. The drums were secured for shipment on with no waste generated.

  • Description: RESPONDED TO OVERGOODS TO FIND CORROSIVE LEAKING PACKAGE WET ON ONE CORNER OF BOX. WEARING FULL PPE, RESPONDER ADDED SILVER SHIELD GLOVES UNDER MY HEAVY GLOVES. READ DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET FOR CORROSIVE PACKAGE, AND TRANSPORTED PACKAGE TO DMP AREA. NO SPILLED LIQUID OUTSIDE OF CARDBOARD BOX, NO NEED TO PH TEST OR ADD SODIUM BICARBONATE. TIGHTENED LID OF LEAKING CONTAINER. PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP. READ WASTE DISPOSAL CHART AND REFERRED TO DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST.

THE OUTER BOXES ARE PREPRINTED COLD PRODUCT AND PERISHABLE. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS GOING TO VARIOUS DESTINATIONS IN THE USA: 1Z88W8R40135904476 AND 1Z88W8R41335903598. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: An Air Products driver arrived at the customer site to make an early morning LOX delivery. There was an unintentional release of LOX behind the delivery location. Around 05:40am, a customer employee was walking approximately 125 yards away from the delivery site. While walking, the customer employee threw a cigarette down to the ground and attempted to extinguish it with his foot. At that moment, there was an ignition impacting the employee. The customer employee was transported to local hospital for treatment and evaluation. The extent of the customer employee's injury is unknown at this time.

I discovered the box was wet on the bottom and little bit of liquid was coming out. There was liquid in the tote. I brought the package to the hazmat cage so I can inspect where the damage and start the process for the damaged hazmat. DescribePack: One of the corner on the box is pushed in. The whole bottom of the box is wet. Opening the box, I can see bit of broken glass on top of the molded pulp packaging to hold the bottles in place. Once removing the molded packaging, I can see one glass bottle is shattered. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed inside the hazardous tote to contain the leaking ethanol solutions.

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-17
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 09/17/2022, at 01:45 hours, A train crew that was conducting switching movement in the Philadelphia south yard QHE 5 discovered that the GATX 73779 a loaded railcar of Hydrogen Peroxide ,having a liquid release from the top of the railcar and no product to the ground at this time. The railcar was isolated and National Response Center Report # 1347498 and the Pennsylvania Emergency management Agency (PEMA), Pennsylvania Public Utilities Commission Bureau of Technical Utility Services – Transportation Division, Rail Safety Section and CHEMTRECK Report # 2022-09-17-00014. Where notified. Marion Environmental a CSX response contractor was dispatched to the scene and found the presser release disk had been Ruptured causing the release. Shipper Solvay Chemicals was advised. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 is not required?

CONTINUED TO CLEAN THE AREA. RETRIEVED THE DAMAGED PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILL TRAY AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE DMP AREA. THEN PROCESSED THE PACKAGE FOLLOWING THE PROPER DMP PROCESS.

item.title: Report X-2022081146
item.description:
Report X-2022081146

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-08
  • City: Cranberry Township
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Employee from our delivery station in Cranberry Township, PA notified their AM Manager to a package they had destined for Matthews Marking Systems, 3159 Unionville Road, Cranberry PA 16066,which began leaking a white substance while on road for delivery. Manager advised the courier to stop delivering and switch vehicles immediately. The Senior Manager investigated the package leak due to being a trained spill cleanup specialist. The leak was contained in the vehicle. The package in question had no dangerous goods identifications on the outside, but was marked with a RMA # on the outside of the package. The package consisted of a fibreboard box with bubble wrap used for dunnage. inside of the box and bubble wrap a part leaking ink was placed for return. The part was the source of the leak. The vehicle and the package were quarantined at this point as the substance was unknown. The Senior Manager contacted the shipping department at Matthews Marking to attempt to obtain a SDS from the RMA Number. They were able to provide a SDS for the leak in question - SCP-8001 White Ink - Printing ink and a flammable hazard symbol was located in the hazard identification subsection of the SDS. Due to the printing ink being shipped being identified as flammable, how ever no dangerous goods marks nor labels being applied to the package a further investigation would be needed as the shipment potentially contained undeclared dangerous goods. Pictures of the packaging and inner-contents of the package were provided to DG Admin. The outer package showed no apparent damage to the outside. The package was moved to a salvage drum and Hold Notification was placed on the outside to indicate the package can not move. Station Management will hold the package for the FAA until further instructions are provided.

item.title: Report I-2022100156
item.description:
Report I-2022100156

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-17
  • City: Philadelphia
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The passenger in 13D rang call light. Flight Attendant went to customer seat and passenger notified that daughter in 13F reached into her purse and felt something hot. She pulled out her vape and it appeared to be overheating. Flight Attendant advised the customer she would be right back. Spoke with#1 Flight Attendant and we concurred that we would use the fire containment bag to secure the overheating vape. They followed the Fire Containment Bag(FCB) procedures and the Flight Attendant walked back to seat 13D. The passenger placed the vape into the bag. The Flight Attendant took it to the back galley and placed another 4 Iiters of water into the bag and sealed it. The Flight Attendant placed the bag into an empty cart. The captain was notified. At arrival city we passed off the FCB to a Customer Service Manager(CSM). It should be noted that the vape was only in a"HOT" stage. The vape never started smoking or ignited. This was a Flum Float vape, the latest in a series that have gone into thermal runaway on American Airlines flights.

  • Description: XPO Terminal XLF called in to report a 1 cup spill of UN3262 "Sodium Metasilicate, Anhydrous" from a 55 pound plastic bag caused by forklift mishandling during dock operations and impacting the dock floor near door 56. ERTS dispatched First Call Environmental to conduct cleanup. At 0810 ET, FCE arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the dock floor due to a tear. The damaged bag and all released product were collected and containerized into a 55 gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022090272
item.description:
Report E-2022090272

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-04
  • City: BLOOMSBURG
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: METROPOLITAN TRUCKING INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 4, 2022, at 0920 ET, Metropolitan Trucking Inc. reported multiple products released inside the back of the trailer floor due to improper loading. ERTS dispatched EnviroServe to perform all clean up operations. On August 4, 2022, at 1105 ET, EnviroServe arrived on site and confirmed the following products released: - ZEP, High pH presoak vehicle wash- (1)5 gallon bucket- 2.5 gal. - ZEP, Touchless Foaming car and truck detergent – (3) 5 gallon buckets- 12 gal. - ZEP, Formula 22- (2) 5 gallon buckets- 10 gal. - ZEP, FS Cooler freezer cleaner- (2) 5 gallon buckets, 10 gal. - ZEP, Sili Free- (4) 5 gallon buckets- 20 gal. EnviroServe removed all impacted pails from the trailer, utilized granular absorbents on impacted areas, collected and containerized damaged pails, spent absorbents into (5) 55-gallon poly drums and (1) 20-gallon poly drum. All waste was transported offsite for disposal.

Internal inspection revealed 4(1) gallon bottles, one of which presented with a loosely attached lid permitting contents to leak out. Of notation was inadequate partitions between all 4 bottles, as well as no padding over the lids. HAZMAT was placed in a lined bin and processed as a damage. DescribePack: The HAZMAT failed when one of the four bottles lost it's secure connection. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT was placed in a lined bin and processed as a damage

item.title: Report E-2022080288
item.description:
Report E-2022080288

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-11T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-04
  • City: PHILA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Roadrunner contacted ERTS to report a spill in Philadelphia PA. He advised that 1 Gal of Magnum Wash-K soap (UN3266 Class 8 PG II ) was released when the 55 Gal DF lid was dislodged during loading. Roadrunner contacted Chemtrec first and they advised him to add sand and water to the spill and then containerize the waste. The waste was placed in a 5 Gal DF recovery drum and staged on site for pending disposal. The original container was able to be re-sealed and was not damaged, per Chemtrec it will be returned to the shipper. Roadrunner overpacked the original 55DF into a 95DF and will make arrangements to return to shipper.

DescribePack: The body became dented on the bottom and extending up the side. Where the bottom and side meet, and where the body was dented, a small crack formed measuring 5mm x 6mm x 2mm, from which product escaped. HAZMAT was placed in a lined bin and processed as a damage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT was placed in a lined bin and processed as a damage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Load manager called QA regarding a malodor emanating from a HAZMAT. On inspection, there was no evidence of damage to the outer, overpack. Examination of inner contents revealed one cylinder with a lid, although secured with electrical tape, not secure at its seal. Approximately 4OZ escaped into the plastic bag surrounding the cylinder. HAZMAT was placed in a lined bin and processed as a damage. DescribePack: The HAZMAT failed when the seal, designed to secure the lid's closure was compromised. This loss of protection from the seal permitted product to escape. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT was placed in a lined in and processed as a damage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was loaded on van and out for delivery to the recipient on 7/5/2022 . It appears that package was attempted late in the day , recipient not in , driver returned to van with package. Package was not secured while in empty van and movement caused package to hit side of van on drive back to station. On the return to station , damage , leakage was discovered. Damage HazMat was placed in salvage red tub (plastic lined) and brought QA HazMat cage. Awaiting for next shift to inspect and do reports as it was end of day when discovered. DescribePack: Glass jug apparent hit hard against side of package , it cracked from the force and leakage began. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Placed in plastic lined Hazmat tub. Majority of the leaking liquid was absorbed by heavy , thick fiberboard box.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Unload manager called QA regarding a wet HAZMAT noted while unloading. Inspection revealed a wet, but not otherwise damaged box. Inner contents consisted of four(1) gallon bottles, one of which had a loosely connected lid which allowed contents to escape. The inner contents were not separated by partitions, nor were lids protected. HAZMAT was placed in a lined bin and processed as a damage. DescribePack: The HAZMAT failed as the lid to one of the four bottles was not secure in its connection, hence contents escaped. Lack of internal partitions, as well as padding, over/around lids contribute to the security of closure being compromised. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT was placed in a lined bin, to contain drainage and then processed as a damage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal XPB called in to report a spill of UN3077 from a 2000 pound supersack caused by improper loading and impacting their trailer floor. ERTS dispatched First Call Environmental to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5 pounds of product released to the box truck in a 24' x 8' area. One bag of floor dry was used to neutralize the trailer floor, applied after they coated the trailer floor in simple green & water to clean any residual material up. The damaged supersack was patched and all cleanup debris was collected into a 55 gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
